template.name: Template Power APC UPS SNMP
template.description:
Template Power APC UPS
MIBs used: PowerNet-MIB
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/
Template tooling version used: 0.38

item.name: Battery capacity
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The remaining battery capacity expressed in percent of full capacity.

item.name: External battery packs count
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The number of external battery packs connected to the UPS. If the UPS does not use smart cells then the agent reports ERROR_NO_SUCH_NAME.

item.name: Battery last replace date
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The date when the UPS system's batteries were last replaced in mm/dd/yy (or yyyy) format. For Smart-UPS models, this value is originally set in the factory. When the UPS batteries are replaced, this value should be reset by the administrator. For Symmetra PX 250/500 this OID is read only and is configurable in the local display only.

item.name: Battery replace indicator
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB Indicates whether the UPS batteries need replacing.

trigger.name: Battery needs replacement
trigger.description: A battery installed has an internal error condition.

item.name: Battery runtime remaining
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The UPS battery run time remaining before battery exhaustion.

item.name: Battery status
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The status of the UPS batteries. A batteryLow(3) value indicates the UPS will be unable to sustain the current load, and its services will be lost if power is not restored. The amount of run time in reserve at the time of low battery can be configured by the upsAdvConfigLowBatteryRunTime. A batteryInFaultCondition(4)value indicates that a battery installed has an internal error condition.

trigger.name: Battery has an internal error condition
trigger.description: A battery installed has an internal error condition.

trigger.name: Battery is Low
trigger.description: The UPS will be unable to sustain the current load, and its services will be lost if power is not restored.

item.name: Battery temperature
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The current internal UPS temperature expressed in Celsius. Temperatures below zero read as 0.

item.name: Battery voltage
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The actual battery bus voltage in Volts.

item.name: Input fail cause
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The reason for the occurrence of the last transfer to UPS battery power. The variable is set to: - noTransfer(1) -- if there is no transfer yet. - highLineVoltage(2) -- if the transfer to battery is caused by an over voltage greater than the high transfer voltage. - brownout(3) -- if the duration of the outage is greater than five seconds and the line voltage is between 40% of the rated output voltage and the low transfer voltage. - blackout(4) -- if the duration of the outage is greater than five seconds and the line voltage is between 40% of the rated output voltage and ground. - smallMomentarySag(5) -- if the duration of the outage is less than five seconds and the line voltage is between 40% of the rated output voltage and the low transfer voltage. - deepMomentarySag(6) -- if the duration of the outage is less than five seconds and the line voltage is between 40% of the rated output voltage and ground. The variable is set to - smallMomentarySpike(7) -- if the line failure is caused by a rate of change of input voltage less than ten volts per cycle. - largeMomentarySpike(8) -- if the line failure is caused by a rate of change of input voltage greater than ten volts per cycle. - selfTest(9) -- if the UPS was commanded to do a self test. - rateOfVoltageChange(10) -- if the failure is due to the rate of change of the line voltage.

trigger.name: UPS has decrease in voltage levels
trigger.description: A decrease in voltage levels. Sometimes this is not visually noticeable.

trigger.name: UPS has over voltage
trigger.description: An over voltage greater than the high transfer voltage.

trigger.name: UPS has total loss of utility power.
trigger.description: A total loss of utility power.

item.name: Input frequency
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The current input frequency to the UPS system in Hz.

trigger.name: Unacceptable input frequency (out of range {$UPS.INPUT_FREQ.MIN.WARN}-{$UPS.INPUT_FREQ.MAX.WARN}Hz for 15m)

item.name: Input voltage
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The current utility line voltage in VAC.

trigger.name: Unacceptable input voltage (out of range {$UPS.INPUT_VOLT.MIN.WARN}-{$UPS.INPUT_VOLT.MAX.WARN}V for 15m)

item.name: Output current
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The current in amperes drawn by the load on the UPS.

item.name: Output load
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The current UPS load expressed in percent of rated capacity.

trigger.name: Output load is high (over {$UPS.OUTPUT.MAX.WARN}% for 15m)
trigger.description: A battery installed has an internal error condition.

item.name: Output status
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The current state of the UPS. If the UPS is unable to determine the state of the UPS this variable is set to unknown(1). During self-test most UPSes report onBattery(3) but some that support it will report onBatteryTest(15). To determine self-test status across all UPSes, refer to the upsBasicStateOutputState OID.

trigger.name: UPS is Sleeping Until Power Return

item.name: Output voltage
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The output voltage of the UPS system in VAC.

item.name: Model
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The UPS model name (e.g. 'APC Smart-UPS 600').

item.name: Serial number
item.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB An 8-character string identifying the serial number of the UPS internal microprocessor. This number is set at the factory. NOTE: This number does NOT correspond to the serial number on the rear of the UPS.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPINDEX}: External battery packs bad
item_prototype.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The number of external battery packs connected to the UPS that are defective. If the UPS does not use smart cells then the agent reports ERROR_NO_SUCH_NAME.

item_prototype.name: {#BATTERY_PACK}.{#CARTRIDGE_INDEX}: Battery estimated replace date
item_prototype.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The battery cartridge estimated battery replace date.

item_prototype.name: {#BATTERY_PACK}.{#CARTRIDGE_INDEX}: Battery pack cartridge health
item_prototype.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The battery cartridge health. bit 0 Battery lifetime okay bit 1 Battery lifetime near end, order replacement cartridge bit 2 Battery lifetime exceeded, replace battery bit 3 Battery lifetime near end acknowledged, order replacement cartridge bit 4 Battery lifetime exceeded acknowledged, replace battery bit 5 Battery measured lifetime near end, order replacement cartridge bit 6 Battery measured lifetime near end acknowledged, order replacement cartridge

item_prototype.name: {#BATTERY_PACK}.{#CARTRIDGE_INDEX}: Battery status
item_prototype.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The battery cartridge status. bit 0 Disconnected bit 1 Overvoltage bit 2 NeedsReplacement bit 3 OvertemperatureCritical bit 4 Charger bit 5 TemperatureSensor bit 6 BusSoftStart bit 7 OvertemperatureWarning bit 8 GeneralError bit 9 Communication bit 10 DisconnectedFrame bit 11 FirmwareMismatch

item_prototype.name: {#BATTERY_PACK}.{#CARTRIDGE_INDEX}: Battery temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The battery pack temperature measured in Celsius.

item_prototype.name: {#BATTERY_PACK}.{#CARTRIDGE_INDEX}: Serial number
item_prototype.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The battery pack serial number.

item_prototype.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR1_NAME}: Humidity sensor
item_prototype.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The sensor's current humidity reading in percent relative humidity. -1 indicates an invalid reading due to either a sensor that doesn't read humidity or lost communications.

item_prototype.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR1_NAME}: Sensor alarm status
item_prototype.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The alarm status of the sensor. Possible values: uioNormal (1), uioWarning (2), uioCritical (3), sensorStatusNotApplicable (4)

trigger_prototype.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR1_NAME}: Sensor has status Not Applicable
trigger_prototype.description: The external sensor is not work or not connected.

trigger_prototype.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR1_NAME}: Sensor has status Warning
trigger_prototype.description: The external sensor has returned a value greater than the warning threshold.

trigger_prototype.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR1_NAME}: Sensor has status Critical
trigger_prototype.description: The external sensor has returned a value greater than the critical threshold.

item_prototype.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR1_NAME}: Temperature sensor
item_prototype.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The sensor's current temperature reading in degrees Celsius. -1 indicates an invalid reading due to lost communications.

item_prototype.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR2_NAME}: Humidity sensor
item_prototype.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The sensor's current humidity reading in percent relative humidity. -1 indicates an invalid reading due to either a sensor that doesn't read humidity or lost communications.

item_prototype.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR2_NAME}: Sensor alarm status
item_prototype.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The alarm status of the sensor. Possible values: uioNormal (1), uioWarning (2), uioCritical (3), sensorStatusNotApplicable (4)

trigger_prototype.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR2_NAME}: Sensor has status Not Applicable
trigger_prototype.description: The external sensor is not work or not connected.

trigger_prototype.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR2_NAME}: Sensor has status Warning
trigger_prototype.description: The external sensor has returned a value greater than the warning threshold.

trigger_prototype.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR2_NAME}: Sensor has status Critical
trigger_prototype.description: The external sensor has returned a value greater than the critical threshold.

item_prototype.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR2_NAME}: Temperature sensor
item_prototype.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The sensor's current temperature reading in degrees Celsius. -1 indicates an invalid reading due to lost communications.

discovery_rule.name: Input phases discovery
discovery_rule.description: The input phase identifier. OID upsPhaseInputPhaseIndex.1.1

item_prototype.name: {#PHASEINDEX}: Phase input voltage
item_prototype.description: MIB: PowerNet-MIB The input voltage in VAC, or -1 if it's unsupported by this UPS.
